attributes.action: Allow MPs a free vote on whether to accept or reject the final Brexit deal
attributes.additional_details: A free vote allows MPs to vote with their conscience, free from party politics. It allows them to vote for what is best for the country and not what is best for their political party. A free vote strengthens the democratic process
attributes.background:
Brexit is the single biggest decision this country has taken in over a generation. 

It is essential the national interest comes first and not party politics. MPs must not be bound by political parties and vote with their conscience.

MPs should be allowed a free vote on the final deal.

rejection.details:
Giving MPs a free vote is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. 
Decisions about whipping are the responsibility of the political parties, not the UK Government or Parliament.
